question: Which of these pairs has the same unit of measurement?
explanation: Pressure and Coefficient of Elasticity have the same unit i.e. N m<sup>-2</sup> (Newton per metre square) Other important units: Rate of Flow: m<sup>3</sup>s<sup>-1</sup> Acceleration: ms<sup>-2</sup> Rydberg constant: 1/m Gas constant: J/K Impulse: Ns Moment of Force: Nm
